adjective.description: Occurring or produced as a result or consequence of something.
examples: restructuring and the resultant cost savings

noun.description: A force, velocity, or other vector quantity which is equivalent to the combined effect of two or more component vectors acting at the same point.

origin: Mid 17th century (in the adjectival sense): from Latin resultant- springing back, from the verb resultare (see result). The noun sense dates from the early 19th century.
